official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that a taxpayer may, with respect to any pollution control facility used in connection with a plant or other property in operation before January 1, 1971, elect a 12-month amortization of such facility or a 20-percent investment tax credit.
short_title: Pollution Control Facilities Tax Incentives Act of 1979

summary.text: Pollution Control Facilities Tax Incentives Act of 1979 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to permit a taxpayer to elect a 12 month amortization period or an additional ten percent investment tax credit for pollution control facilities used in connection with a plant or other property in operation before January 1, 1971.

titles.title: Pollution Control Facilities Tax Incentives Act of 1979

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that a taxpayer may, with respect to any pollution control facility used in connection with a plant or other property in operation before January 1, 1971, elect a 12-month amortization of such facility or a 20-percent investment tax credit.
